channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US presidential election slipping away from Kamala Harris? What Democrats think
item.description: Democratic concerns are mounting as Vice President Harris appears to be losing footing against former President Trump in critical battleground states. Polls in Michigan, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin, among others, indicate a shift towards Trump, alarming strategists. However, Harris's vigorous campaign efforts and upcoming key appearances keep some Democrats hopeful for a turnaround.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: McDonald’s E. Coli outbreak: List of states affected, latest updates
item.description: McDonald’s E. Coli outbreak: ​There are many kinds of harmless E. coli, but a few types can make people seriously ill. The McDonald's outbreak is caused by E. coli O157:H7, which produces a toxin that causes dangerous diarrhea and can lead to kidney failure and other serious problems, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Prince Harry a 'slaughter lamb' in Meghan Markle's wrong scheme of things'
item.description: Royal author Tina Brown said Meghan Markle is flawless at getting everything wrong. She had the worst judgement and though she has people whom she asks for advice, she does not listen to those and does what she thinks right and that is inevitably always wrong. The author said Meghan has run out of road but Harry will always remain Harry and he's best at being that.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Personal trainer accuses 'Diddy' of drugging and passing him ‘around like a party favor’ to A-listers
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nate Silver's gut says Donald Trump is winning: 'But don't trust anyone's gut'
item.description: "So OK, I'll tell you. My gut says Donald Trump. And my guess is that it is tru for many anxious Democrats," Nate wrote. "But I don’t think you should put any value whatsoever on anyone’s gut — including mine. Instead, you should resign yourself to the fact that a 50-50 forecast really does mean 50-50. And you should be open to the possibility that those forecasts are wrong, and that could be the case equally in the direction of Mr. Trump or Ms. Harris."

item.title: Yelp disables reviews of McDonald’s where Trump served fries. Here's why
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk calls Eminem 'yet another Diddy..' after his support for Kamala Harris
item.description: ​But Elon Musk's attack on Eminem did not go down well with Eminem fans as Eminem and Diddy were not friends and Eminem had been taking potshots at Diddy for decaes. Eminem's latest album The Death of Slim Shady is believed to be a dig at Diddy. And this is not new. Eminem's war with Diddy is old and many of his lyrics mention Diddy like: "Sorry, Puff, but I don't give a f**k", "Get of me, go f**k Puffy" etc.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy hits out at Eminem's 'retribution' attack: 'It wasn't Trump'
item.description: Sharing the clip, Republican leader and former GOP preidcent hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy hit back at Eminen and said there's only one presidnet in the US history who is pursuing legal retribution against the opposition candidate and that's not Trump. Referring to the lawsuits against Trump and blamind the Biden-Harris administration for that, Vivek posted: "There’s only one President in U.S. history that has pursued legal retribution against the opposition candidate in the middle of an election. Hint: it wasn’t Trump."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: First AI death? Character.ai faces lawsuit after Florida teen's suicide. He was speaking to Daenerys Targaryen
item.description: 14-year-old Sewell Setzer III knew that Daenerys Targaryen, a chatbot based on a character of Game of Thrones, was not a real person but he developed an emotional attachment and used to text the bot constantly. On his last day of his life too, he messaged Dany: "I miss you, baby sister." “I miss you too, sweet brother,” the chatbot replied.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hitler-admirer', 'dictionary-definition fascist': Why John Kelly turned on Trump
item.description: John Kelly, Donald Trump's ex-chief of staff, accused Trump of being a fascist, citing admiration for dictators like Hitler and a disregard for the rule of law. Kelly's comments come amid the tight election race between Trump and Kamala Harris. ​“Well, looking at the definition of fascism: It’s a far-right authoritarian, ultranationalist political ideology and movement characterized by a dictatorial leader, centralized autocracy, militarism, forcible suppression of opposition, belief in a natural social hierarchy,” Kelly said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: American Airlines fined $50 million for mishandling wheelchairs, injuring passengers
item.description: American Airlines faces a $50 million fine for failing to properly assist disabled passengers and mishandling over 10,760 wheelchairs from 2019 to 2023. The DOT investigation revealed systemic neglect and injury incidents, prompting unprecedented penalties. Despite recent improvements and compensations, advocacy groups call for more robust measures to protect disabled travelers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk's ex Grimes says she became 'way less gay' after...
item.description: Grimes and Elon Musk share three children: four-year-old son X Æ A-12 Musk; three-year-old daughter Exa Dark Sideræl; and son Techno Mechanicus, whose exact age is not known. Grimes made an intriguing X post as she said she became "way less gay" after she became pregnant. "I became way less gay after I was pregnant, my ability to focus on reading and writing went way up, as did my general creativity, but my ability to focus on technical things went *way* down. Is this all explained by hormones?" she wanted to know from X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trump will win if early voting trends hold, and that's a big if...'
item.description: Analyst Mark Halperin said early voting numbers need to be tracked "day to day" and these figures are "more important than the polls right now" because "it's giving us insight into a variety of factors that are counting for a Republican overperformance by various metrics in the early voting in the battleground states". But one downside of relying too much on these early voting numbers is that it's not know who they are voting. "It can change. We don't know exactly who's casting these ballots, how they are voting etc," Halperin said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Israeli missile destroys Beirut building in seconds – Dramatic footage caught on camera
item.description: Israeli forces conducted a missile strike on a Beirut apartment building, captured in real-time by an AP photographer. Despite prior warnings leading to evacuation and no casualties, the attack highlights the ongoing offensive targeting Hezbollah strongholds and financial resources in Lebanon, escalating regional tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Lawmakers: South Korea's spy chief says North Korea has sent another 1,500 troops to Russia
item.description: South Korea's spy agency reports that North Korea has sent a total of 3,000 special operation forces to Russia to aid in its war against Ukraine, with plans to deploy 10,000 troops by December. Strengthened military cooperation between North Korea and Russia raises concerns about potential advancements in North Korea's nuclear and missile capabilities, particularly for South Korea.

item.title: Japan introduces blade-proof umbrellas on trains to enhance passenger safety
item.description: To bolster passenger safety, 1,200 blade-resistant umbrellas will be placed on 600 trains in Japan's Kansai region. Introduced by JR West after recent knife attacks, these lightweight umbrellas have reinforced components to act as shields. They are practical for use in emergencies, offering protection and allowing passengers to evacuate safely.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Marriage apps in Pakistan challenge traditional 'rishta aunties'
item.description: Competition between traditional rishta aunties and marriage apps for matchmaking in Pakistan is intensifying. While apps offer privacy features, they face stigma due to cultural norms. Despite rising popularity with 1.2 million users, traditional methods remain strong, reflecting societal pressures and family dynamics in arranged marriages.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Received credible information ... ': US embassy issues travel warning for tourists in Sri Lanka
item.description: The US embassy in Sri Lanka has issued a warning of a potential attack on the popular surfing spot Arugam Bay, prompting enhanced security for tourists. This follows social media calls to boycott Israeli-owned businesses and protests against Israel. Authorities have set up a hotline and are coordinating efforts to ensure the safety of visitors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ivanka takes daughter to Taylor Swift concert despite Trump's 'hate' for 'childless cat lady'
item.description: Ivanka Trump took her daughter Arabella to a Taylor Swift concert in Miami. This was surprising because Taylor Swift endorsed Kamala Harris against Donald Trump. Despite political differences, Ivanka wanted to make sure her daughter's admiration for the singer remained unaffected. A plane with a banner mocking Taylor's political stance also appeared at the event.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hong Kong bars services like WhatsApp and Google Drive from govt computers
item.description: The Hong Kong government bans most civil servants from using apps like WhatsApp and Google Drive on work computers citing security risks. Workers can still use these services on personal devices at work. The measure is to combat data leaks and hacking, with possibilities for exceptions with manager approval.
